channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Increase in Latest Week
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories rose for the first time in four weeks, and gasoline and distillate stocks increased amid lower demand, according to EIA dat...

item.title: Apple’s AirPods-as-hearing-aid play is a $13 billion market opportunity that can help — but not transform — hearing-loss care
item.description: New AirPods functionality could ease stigma for those with hearing loss.

item.title: How a Private-Equity Payday Drained a Hospital Chain of Cash
item.description: Steward Health Care recently went bust, years after paying a $790 million dividend to its shareholders.

item.title: AI-powered stock ETFs were hyped as superior investments. Then reality hit.
item.description: It’s tempting to think that computers can make better investment decisions than we can.

item.title: Retirees Will Get a Smaller Social Security Raise in 2025---and That's OK
item.description: Next year’s cost-of-living adjustment is expected to be 2.5% as inflation cools.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses the big question on investors’ minds
item.description: Nvidia’s stock has bounced and is now up 4% in Wednesday action.

item.title: Topgolf Sent Callaway Into the Rough
item.description: The recreational driving-range business has been a drag for the top golf-equipment maker.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to be unfair’: My mother gave me $150,000 to buy a house. One sibling wants 15% ownership. What now?
item.description: “I do not want to be unfair to my siblings, but I also do not want them to own an interest in my house.”

item.title: A Recession Signal Is Flashing Red. Or Is It?
item.description: When the yield curve turns positive, the country is usually about to plunge into recession. Hope this time relies on a few historical exceptions.

item.title: The stock market is falling after CPI report. Investors may fear Fed mistake.
item.description: August’s consumer-price index came in close to expectations and reinforced traders’ expectations for a regular-size, 25-basis-point rate cut from the ...
